channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: To save its unique and rare birds, New Zealand is turning to AI and genetic research
item.description: New Zealand is planning to eradicate millions of invasive animals that prey on the country's rare birds. The goal may not be possible, unless new technology can be developed to do it.
item.content:encoded:
New Zealand is planning to eradicate millions of invasive animals that prey on the country's rare birds. The goal may not be possible, unless new technology can be developed to do it.

(Image credit: Yang Liu)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Sommer

item.title: How CDC's vaccine advisers could affect policy. And, Jimmy Kimmel pulled off the air
item.description: CDC vaccine advisers meet today to discuss recommendations for COVID vaccines and childhood shots. And, ABC suspends Jimmy Kimmel's late-night show after his remarks about the killing of Charlie Kirk.
item.content:encoded:
CDC vaccine advisers meet today to discuss recommendations for COVID vaccines and childhood shots. And, ABC suspends Jimmy Kimmel's late-night show after his remarks about the killing of Charlie Kirk.

(Image credit: Jessica McGowan)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Kirk shooting videos spread online, even to viewers who didn't want to see them
item.description: Graphic videos of the Charlie Kirk shooting spread widely online, raising concerns over the emotional and political toll of exposure to violent imagery.
item.content:encoded:
Graphic videos of the Charlie Kirk shooting spread widely online, raising concerns over the emotional and political toll of exposure to violent imagery.

(Image credit: Michael Ciaglo)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: Trump is deploying the National Guard to Memphis. Experts worry it's becoming normal
item.description: The president signed an order earlier this week to send Tennessee state National Guard troops, along with officials from various federal departments and agencies, into Memphis, in an effort to fight crime. It's one of several U.S. cities Trump has singled out for such a move, testing the limits of presidential power and military force.
item.content:encoded:
The president signed an order earlier this week to send Tennessee state National Guard troops, along with officials from various federal departments and agencies, into Memphis, in an effort to fight crime. It's one of several U.S. cities Trump has singled out for such a move, testing the limits of presidential power and military force.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: What does the Google antitrust ruling mean for the future of AI?
item.description: A federal judge's mild ruling in the Justice Department's suit over Google's search engine monopoly has critics worried that the tech giant can now monopolize artificial intelligence.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge's mild ruling in the Justice Department's suit over Google's search engine monopoly has critics worried that the tech giant can now monopolize artificial intelligence.

(Image credit: Richard Drew)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: ABC pulls Jimmy Kimmel off air after comments made about the Charlie Kirk killing
item.description: ABC announced Wednesday that Jimmy Kimmel Live! would be off the air indefinitely following comments regarding speculation swirling around the suspect in the killing of Charlie Kirk.
item.content:encoded:
ABC announced Wednesday that Jimmy Kimmel Live! would be off the air indefinitely following comments regarding speculation swirling around the suspect in the killing of Charlie Kirk.

(Image credit: Phil McCarten/Invision)
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: Why beef prices are higher than ever (and shoppers are finally resisting)
item.description: American ranchers are raising the fewest cows in decades. Through the price increases, American shoppers have stayed loyal to their love of burgers and steaks — until now.
item.content:encoded:
American ranchers are raising the fewest cows in decades. Through the price increases, American shoppers have stayed loyal to their love of burgers and steaks — until now.

(Image credit: Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: Foreign influencers are doing their best to spin the Charlie Kirk assassination
item.description: Russia, Iran and China have all attempted to shape the narrative, but so far, their influence has been relatively minor, experts say.
item.content:encoded:
Russia, Iran and China have all attempted to shape the narrative, but so far, their influence has been relatively minor, experts say.

(Image credit: Jesse Bedayn)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Why was Kirk killed? Evidence paints complicated picture of alleged assassin
item.description: The killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk has unleashed a frenzy of recrimination — and finger-pointing. But the suspect's politics may be less clear than some say.
item.content:encoded:
The killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk has unleashed a frenzy of recrimination — and finger-pointing. But the suspect's politics may be less clear than some say.

(Image credit: Charly Triballeau)
item.dc:creator: Odette Yousef

item.title: New policies are making life harder for trans people — and prompting big financial decisions
item.description: White House executive orders and legislation in many states have targeted the rights and protections of trans people. For some, that has meant increased financial worry.
item.content:encoded:
White House executive orders and legislation in many states have targeted the rights and protections of trans people. For some, that has meant increased financial worry.

(Image credit: Stephanie Amador Blondet)
item.dc:creator: Laurel Wamsley
